node.text:
☀️ Good morning from this precious baby at Sullifarm 🐮 
 
@farmstandrevival’s NEWEST Featured Farm: 👍 @sullifarmandkitchen

“Here at Sullifarm, we embrace a rather full-circle scene in agriculture.  One that’s all about restoration, repair, healing and health.  We don’t just grow food, we strive to regenerate our soils and pastures in the process. 

Pasture-raising animals according to their natures thus creating the tastiest and healthiest food products in a local and regenerative farm setting.”

Hooks, TX
📸: @sullifarmandkitchen
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Join the movement! 👩‍🌾 👍 Let’s Revive Small Local Farms 🙌🏻 We feature small regenerative growers 👩‍🌾 👨‍🌾 from around the world! 🥕
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Support Us by checkin’ out our SMALL-SCALE FARMING APPAREL! 🤩💚 Link in bio --> @farmstandrevival *1 % Of Profits Donated To Supporting Small Farms!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

node.text:
Good morning!
The pea microgreens are almost ready for harvest.
Pea greens are great for salads, sandwiches, burgers, omelettes and smoothies. Great for weight management and high in vitamins and minerals. 

We are happy to take pre-orders for Saturday and Sunday's.

Pick up on Saturday's at @fredfarmmarket 
Deliveries on Sunday 

Please message us for more details.
Thank you 🌱

node.text:
Some fruit each day keeps the Dr away. Unless he's cute, then stuff the fruit! 
.
I'm making these sweet little glass fruit earrings which will be for sale with the launch of our Rascal's farm website (coming up!!) I'm really excited to get the site up so I can share with everyone what were up too on our permiculture block, as well as some DIY self sufficiency projects and blogs. 
All sales will go toward funding our farm and helping me plant a syntropics food forest 🌱 If you're interested in buying a pair for Christmas, let me know and I'll send you a sneak peak pic of the full range :) 
.
#christmas #fruit #lampwork #jewelry #earrings #trending #rascalsfarm #smallscalefarming #smallbuisness #fundraising #jewellery #handmade #fashion #gold

Treat yourselves or your friends and family to a thoughtful and locally produced gift. All items in this bag have been lovingly handcrafted from small local and sustainable businesses including as many organic ingredients as possible.

The Piccolo Gift Bag:

🤍Piccolo Farm own printed cotton tote bag.

💚Piccolo Fresh Cucumber Pickles 300ml (organic cucumbers, water, vinegar, organic raw sugar & himalayan pink salt - Our own popular swedish pickles recipe!

💖Piccolo Herb de Provence Pink Salt 300ml (Himalayan pink salt, organic herbs incl. oregano, savoury, thyme, sage, lavender & basil - Traditionally used on dishes like roast chicken, roast lamb, grilled fish, and roasted vegetables.

🧡Raw Honey 400g from @little_hill_farm 

💛Pineapple & Petals Tea 300ml from @earth.air.fire.water.organics (all organic: pineapple, elderberry, mallow, rose hips and hibiscus) - Tea suitable also for cold infusions

🐝 Medium Skep Candle made from 100% beeswax with propolis from @pure_beeing 

Get it in our online shop ☺️

node.text:
Wir teilen nicht nur Risiken und Gewinn, sondern auch unser Know-How. Auf unserer Plattform für Crowd-Projekte stellen wir unsere Erfahrungen allen zur Verfügung, die unsere Vision eines gerechteren Handels teilen.
Mittels Sammelbestellung erreichen wir gemeinsam die Mindestmenge für einen Export. Oder wir finanzieren via Crowdfunding zusammen Projekte für mehr Nachhaltigkeit und Gerechtigkeit. Dank über 16.000 Unterstützenden konnten wir bisher 34 Crowd-Projekte erfolgreich durchführen und so Bauern und Verarbeitern einen Export – oftmals den ersten überhaupt – ermöglichen.
#WeAreChangingTheRules! Welche Regeln wir sonst noch ändern, erfährst Du auf unserer Website. Link im Profil.
══════════════
We do not only share risk and revenue but also our know-how.
On our platform for crowd projects we provide our experience to initiatives who share our vision of a more sustainable and fair trade.
Through crowd orders we reach the minimum quantities that are required to realize a first export of products. Thanks to more than 16.000 contributors and supporters, we managed to complete a total of 34 crowd projects so far and thus make a first export possible for farmer families and producers. #WeAreChangingTheRules! Find out what other rules we are changing on our website. Link in our profile.
________________________________
#WeAreChangingTheRules #YouAreChangingTheRules #WeltweitAbHof #PioneerOfChange #sustainableinvestment #beyondfairtrade #beyondorganic #chooseorganic #choosefairtrade #ethicalcompany #fairtradefoods #mehralsbio #nachhaltigerkonsum #bewusstleben #ökologisch #smallscalefarming #organicproduce #ethicalconsumption #reducewaste #reducefoodwaste #wertschöfpung #naturefirst #localproduce #eatseasonal #seasonalproduce #gemeinsambewegen #globalchange #activechange

We are testing some different supplemental lights in the new #greenhouse to see what is the most cost efficient way to give our #microgreens some more light during the winter. The goal is to add supplemental lighting during low light days without breaking the bank with high end fixtures. We are testing different LED “flood” style grow lights from @gecurrent_daintree (left) and @philipshorticulture (right) to see what are plants (and wallet) like the most. #BootstrapFarming

node.text:
It was a bittersweet weekend.
.
.
My wife's family made the decision to have an auction and liquidate all the farm equipment and tools. Her Grandpa purchased this land and farmstead in 1953 I believe and farmed it until he couldn't any longer. He's no longer with us, but during the hay days, I'm told the buildings and equipment were spotless and very organized. It was the unofficial end to an era for the family. Support your local farmers and buy local food. These small operations rely on local sales. Represent your support with one of our Nebraska Support Local Farms designs. Check our link in the bio.

node.text:
NEW! If you missed the cutoff for ordering by 5pm on Mondays, that's ok because you can now place an order right up until 9am Wednesday morning for boxes that can be picked up on Thursday. 

While it's not the full selection that's on offer from Saturday to Monday, it is very close! Some items need to be made to order (like the gluten free products) and some fruit and veg is only available in limited quantities so these aren't on the late edition form, but we always request a bit extra from the growers and makers - definitely enough to put an order together for you 🙂

All the fresh produce is organic and over 90% is grower and maker direct from a bunch of wonderful producers in Margaret River and the wider south west. 

The full range of pick and delivery options are available, from Karridale up to Dunsborough and West Busselton.

You can find the latest order form at www.gatheredorganics.com.au 😀

(pic is of the just harvested white onions coming our way tomorrow from @Rolypolyfarm)
.
.

node.text:
#showusyagarlic @farmerincubator

• • • • • •

Its THAT time of the year. 
#youngfarmers are getting together and getting into their garlic harvest all around the country. 
Let's see all that great garlic folks ! 
People coming together sharing and growing. 
Send your pics or tag a Garlic Farmer #showusyagarlic

• • • • • •

Yesterday was World Soil Day and there was no better way to celebrate than by spending the day at Farmer Incubator HQ. Our garlic crop has been curing for weeks and together we made a huge dent in preparing the garlic for PUGF 2021 seed and for market. Stay tuned for more information about how to purchase our certified organic garlic!
.
.

node.text:
Haven't had to do this since we were super poor in an apartment and could not afford coin-operated laundry facilities. Later today ill be cutting a hole out of a 5gallon bucket lid so I can do small batches easier. Thank GOD this isn't 2008 and now we only have to wait a week or two before we can get a new washer and dryer set and thank GOD it's only the washer that broke because line drying in winter takes ages and I don't feel like setting up drying lines in the house.

Stay tuned.

SUPPORT REGENERATIVE FARMING THIS CHRISTMAS!⁠
⁠
Our friends over at the @thegaiafoundation have created this handy guide of how to support regenerative farming this Christmas. ⁠
⁠
First up is @wefeedtheworld - a brand new 300-page photographic book celebrating the stories of the farmers and fishing communities that feed the world!⁠
⁠
Over three years The Gaia Foundation gathered together 47 of the world’s most renowned photographers, including Rankin, Susan Meiselas, Martin Parr and Graciela Iturbide, to photograph the triumphs and challenges of the world’s smallholder farmers and fishing communities. Documented through a series of poignant and intimate portraits, theirs are stories of resilience, of community, nutrition, agroecology, women’s empowerment and the critical role of seed and food sovereignty in navigating the climate emergency.⁠
⁠
This timely and important book amplifies the voices of the people who really feed the world.⁠
⁠
Brought to you by The Gaia Foundation and published by @littletollerdorset. Please support independent bookshops!

node.text: I love customers that make me laugh, especially late on a Saturday afternoon. 🙏 especially ones who are working hard for small businesses like ourselves.  We feel incredibly sorry for those businesses who have closed and our thoughts are with them💚. We are very grateful to have been open all year. We are also looking forward to a rest once you all have your Christmas food. My staff have worked SO HARD, thank you all🙏🙏🙏💚#savethehighstreet #shoplocal #smallshop #weetabixfoodanddrinkawards2020 #marketharborough #northamptonshire #leicestershire #ecovillageuk #smallscalefarming #regenerativeagriculture

node.text:
In this episode I share 5 mistakes I made when starting my microgreens business.
▫️
Link in bio 👆
▫️
Making mistakes when starting a business is inevitable, but by listening to this episode, you will be able to avoid making some of the mistakes that I  made, and this could save you time and money in the long run.
▫️
In this episode you'll learn:
1️⃣That mistakes are inevitable, it's how you learn and improve from them that counts.
2️⃣Why pricing your microgreens correctly is so important.
3️⃣Why the amount of different varieties you grow is important.
4️⃣Why investing in your business and yourself is important, and can lead to making money faster.
5️⃣How being organised and prepared when approaching potential clients is important.
.
.
. 
.
.
.
.
.
. 
#microgreens #microgreens🌱 #alwayslearning 
#urbangardening #entrepreneur #microgreensbusiness #smallbusinessowner #growmicrogreensforprofit #microgreensfarmtotable #urbanfarming #microgreenspodcast #podcast #ebook #indoorfarming #growyourownfood #sustainability #microfarm #farmfresh #organic #smallscalefarming #plantbased #businessopportunity #locallygrown #eatlocal #growyourown #howtogrowmicrogreens #homebusiness #startupbusiness #beyourownboss #entreprenurial

The right to food is not about charity, but about ensuring that all people have the capacity to feed themselves in dignity.'.

node.text:

node.text:
Garden no.3 👨‍🌾👩‍🌾 there are so many people (mostly students) working this garden right now!

It is both a joy and nerve wracking for me because I love the engagement but there is zero planning going on. On the one hand it is growing organically and that is a good thing because it is naturally being adjusted to its user's needs BUT... Omg, my planner of a brain shrieks at the lack of proper paths and the inexistent working bench/table; no flower borders or sitting area; the tool shed is tiny and ALWAYS messy and full of dirt; no proper compost pile and tools scattered around 😬

I am only on the second year on this school and lots of changes going on with the board and budgeting, so I trust that eventually my insights and suggestions will make it through.

A schoolyard garden truly is a work in progress, especially when so many different people and different uses are involved.

#gardening #schoolgardens #gardeningwithkids #growingvegetables #smallscalefarming #community_gardens #urbangardens #ilovemyjob #schoolteachers #teaching_gardening #gardeningteachers #gardeningtips

node.text:
It’s feeling a little empty around the farm this morning 😢 we’ve had family here with us for over a month now, and they finally had to go back home back to Georgia. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
It was so nice to have neighbors just down the lane (they were staying in the old hunting cottage my grandparents remodeled several years back). 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
We miss you guys! Sure is quiet around here now. PS how awesome are these planters built by my great grandfather and planted by @youmansj1 to make the cottage feel like home?
.
.
.
.
.

node.text:
All bundled up and ready for winter work. We created our insulated 12 oz waxed cotton work jackets exactly for moments like this; clothing that will perform and accompany you through all types of weather, even when it’s minus below and the snow won’t stop falling. ☃️⁠⠀
⁠⠀
〰️⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Tout est préparé et prêt pour les tâches hivernales. Nous avons créé nos manteaux de travail isolées en coton ciré de 12 onces exactement pour des moments comme ceux-ci. Ces vêtements vous accompagneront par tous les temps, même quand il fait plus froid et que la neige ne cesse de tomber.☃️⁠⠀
⁠⠀

node.text: Liberating Lawns is up again and a bit changed. Sundance Harvest is volunteering time running this program this year and I will be focusing on BIPOC youth as growers. If you think this is groovy check out the link in my bio. You need to fill out an intake form so please do see the link in my bio before DMing as all of the info is in my site ❤️

This year’s hoop house celery is proving to be the gift that keeps on giving this December!💥
Celery can be a tough thing to grow, especially at home.  We find that a regular supply of water through drip irrigation and growing under cover in the hoop house are key to success. Celery needs A LOT of water to stay juicy and crisp, but not too much from overhead as it can rot.  Have you tried growing celery at home or on your farm? How did it go?? 🌱

node.text:
The year is almost ending and it's a beautiful time to reflect on how the year went.

This year was definitely a special one with all the adaptations we had to make to survive. But in all, we're grateful that we all made it this far.

One of our goals this year was to train as many snail farmers, both new and old and by God's grace, we have been able to. The fact that we were able to adjust to virtual consultations definitely helped us meet this goal.

We just want to say a big thank you to every single one of you who booked a consultation session with us or referred to us to someone. Thank you to everyone who patronized us in one way or the other. And thank you to God who sustained us all.

Don't forget that this year was difficult for everybody and so, don't put unnecessary pressure on yourself because you weren't able to achieve one thing or the other. Just be grateful for what you've achieved and be ready to keep pushing.

node.text: With 3,000 olive trees, we are assisted in the grove by 100 or more free-ranging guinea fowl. These tireless workers reduce pests and weeds and further enrich the soil along their way. With their curious and comical nature these devoted workers are a constant source of inspiration and amusement. In recognition of their dedication this is "Guinea Grove Farm”.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Guinea Grove Farm in Gingin, Western Australia.

node.text: A beautiful sign of summer and Christmas in WA, is the iconic native West Australian Christmas tree (Nuytsia floribunda) here it is in full flower with the grove in the background. ☀️✨

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Guinea Grove Farm in Gingin, Western Australia. Image may contain: outdoor and nature.

node.text:
One thing that farming teaches us is that it’s important to persist and to keep growing. Embracing new opportunities for growth allows us to apply whatever lessons we’ve learned in the past and to test ourselves to be better than we were before. 

Earlier this season we had the opportunity to direct seed some red radishes to take to market and after a few weeks of TLC they are doing well! This is a pleasant outcome in contrast to our challenging summer and fall season. We’ve learned to pay more attention to little details like thinning our root crops and making sure they get sufficient water(more than our greens). The results of our efforts have led to a seasonal success for these delicious radishes and we can’t wait to carry the growth into our spring season! 

What are some small or major successes you’ve had in your space this season? Let us know!🙌🏾🌱✨💯
•
•
•
#growingfood #gardening #notill #radish #smallscalefarming #plants #regenerativeagriculture #tallahassee #permaculture #regenerativefarming #blackfarmers #womenwhofarm #growyourown #learning #education #growth #farming

I am forever sick of sticks and dirt in my shoes, and I always loose my classic green boot covers. So I decided to get a bit funky with my garden wear! 
Now my boots are clean at the end of a day, and the creatures in my garden think I'm stylish - Win/Win! 😁
I'm keen to use these on a doof dancefloor next year and keep the dust out of my stompers. If anyone wants a pair, I have loads of fabric and can sew some extras -  I'm calling them: Boot Skirts! 🥾
.
.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Samuel Lewis (SEL) on December 07, 2020. Image may contain: text that says '# SEL 30,11.20'.

node.text:
On a snowy morning with a teat in each hand, milk streaming into the bucket with each firm squeeze, you can almost escape. The sound of the milk hitting the bucket is pleasantly tinny, as the bucket fills up the sound grows richer and deeper. You can hear the cow chewing her grain, her body is warm, the cat rubs against your legs asking to be fed, the milk smells fresh and sweet, the snow falls outside. For a moment you are just there. The bucket is full and when you pick it up it feels so heavy, you remember what an expense the grain is, you think of how you cannot take your children to the library, how record numbers of people are dying, the snow feels cold on your face, you think of how rough the boys have been with each other lately, of the laundry and dishes piled up, of the lists. As you walk back through the snow your head fills up like a game of Tetris where the pieces are coming too fast and you can’t figure out where to put them. All day you chip away at the laundry, you cross a few things off lists, some because you did them and some because you no longer care to do them, the dishes get done. Once you look over and the boys are playing happily together, the radio fills up all the space with bad news, the coffee is reheated and forgotten, reheated and forgotten, you put on an extra pair of wool socks. On a snowy evening snuggled in tight between your children you can almost escape. You hear them both breathing, the fire crackles pleasantly, snow falls outside, the quilt feels warm and heavy, the children snuggle in closer and for a moment you are just there.
.
.
.
.
#farmlife #womenwhofarm #homesteading #growyourownfood #growyourownmedicine #backtotheland #selfsufficient #modernhomesteading #smallfarm #smallscalefarming #farmfamily #backtotheland2020

node.text:
Garden and outside farm work is slowing down and wrapping up just in time to go FULL THROTTLE on the HOLIDAYS. I’m giving you all a present, it’s like an advent calendar for adults. Not 24 airplane bottles, no no better than that; one holiday craft project everyday from the 1st of December to the 25th. I’m putting together a list right now, and I’ll make a supplies list sometime soon so you can get stuff to participate. Let’s craft so hard this holiday season that we don’t know where the glue ends and our bodies begin, okay? Bye for now.
.
.
.
.
#farmlife #womenwhofarm #homesteading #growyourownfood #growyourownmedicine #backtotheland #selfsufficient #modernhomesteading #smallfarm #smallscalefarming #farmfamily #backtotheland2020

.

.
I just love seeing small, passionate initiatives like these take foot and steadily grow stronger as people around them understand just how lucky they are to get access to this kind of produce. And just how much small businesses like these bring to a local area 👊 #shoplocalforthewin #londonlockdown2
.

node.text:
This week we are happy to share with you @sullifarmandkitchen 👩‍🌾 They strive to build community around food, to have relationships with the families that consume their product.  They want you to know where your food comes from, how it was produced, how it affects you, and how it affects the environment around you. 💛

@farmstandrevival’s NEWEST Featured Farm: 👍 @sullifarmandkitchen

“Here at Sullifarm, we embrace a rather full-circle scene in agriculture.  One that’s all about restoration, repair, healing and health.  We don’t just grow food, we strive to regenerate our soils and pastures in the process. 
.
Pasture-raising animals according to their natures thus creating the tastiest and healthiest food products in a local and regenerative farm setting.”

Hooks, TX
📸: @sullifarmandkitchen
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by 🍇Garden Community🍇 on November 26, 2020. Image may contain: outdoor.

node.text: We have been so busy getting the farm ready for winter but I’m happy to say we got the new greenhouse up and running right before the first snowfall of the season. It’s not perfect but I’m proud of how it came out and happy to have more space for our #microgreens 🌱Building a greenhouse from scratch was the easy part, growing in Tahoe during the winter will be the challenging part. 🌱🌱🌱 #HighAltitudeFarming
